content.description: Thor is the Crack to the left of Astrid. Jam your way up the corner until you get into a closing book that is cut off by a hummock. Clip the bolt to the right and step down until you can step out onto the face. Traverse right and climb through easy face climbing (5.6). continue past the next couple bolts until you get to the Anchor. This anchor is the same one for Astrid and Loki below it.
content.protection:
Fingers to fists

Two 60m or a 70m. Or one 60 has been said to be doable if you stay left.
content.location: once you arive to the shaded area of Valhalla. Thor is to the left of the vertical dike in a small, rounded corner.

content.description:
The is the right most route that shares an anchor with Astrid and Thor

Follow an arching flake from a ledge, up a crack then to a small tree, before rejoining to upper crack and the shared anchor with Astrid and Thor.

Quite fun, and will get better as it cleans up.
content.location: Furtherest to the climbers right of the three routes in the area. Follows obvious flake system.

content.description: Astrid starts at a vertical gray dike and follows it for it's entire length. The thin start is a crux as well as the section before the bulge. The bolts have a bit of space between them but they're in all the right places and you'll need a couple of pieces for the crack three-fourths up the climb. The Gray dike offers thoroughly ascetic climbing, with great friction, lie-backing and side pulls.
content.protection:
Mostly bolts, with a 3" piece and finger sized piece for the crack part way up. 11 or so draws.

two 60m ropes to get down while one 60 will only work if you swing left the whole way down. One 70m Works swell.
content.location: When heading to Valhalla continue until you're under an oak canopy and you can see a thin flake, The grey dike and a crack in a right-facing corner.
